context.p: Eucalyptus components use a variety of ports to communicate. The following table lists the all of the important ports used by Eucalyptus.

row.entry: SSL port for the administrative web user interface. Configurable with euca-modify-property.
DEBUG ONLY: JMX port. This is disabled by default, and can be enabled with the --debug or --jmx options for CLOUD_OPTS.
Web services port for the CLC, Walrus, SC, and VB; also used for external and internal communications by the CLC and Walrus. Configurable with euca-modify-property.
Web services port on the CC. Configured in the eucalyptus.conf configuration file.
Web services port on the NC. Configured in the eucalyptus.conf configuration file.
Used by the image cacher on the CC. Configured in the eucalyptus.conf configuration file.
Port for the administrative web user interface. Forwards to 8443. Configurable with euca-modify-property.
Distributed cache port on the CLC, Walrus, SC, and VB.

context.note: The CLC, Walrus, VB and SC open a random port for detection of component failures.
Any firewall running on the CC must be compatible with the dynamic changes performed by Eucalyptus when working with security groups. Eucalyptus will flush the 'filter' and 'nat' tables upon boot.
